column5: Spiel-  Wow the whole lot of them are beautiful. Can wait until the you ship the best looking one to my wife! She just saw it and loves it! Sorry you lost sleep time because of my wife. Now she wont be stealing the one I got from you last year.  You are a true Craftsman  Hope you have a good weekend!  - Steven

Which one has the tip soft enough to tell when there's a trace of weed still hanging on to your Wiggler (in Firetiger, ofcourse), but has enough backbone to chuck a 3/4 oz. spoon 75 yrds.........against the wind.  Not to mention the odd occasion when the lift-drop of a Glo-Buzz Bomb will get strikes from rivermouth salmon when all else fails (you taught me that one........<cough>ACE<cough>)   Still looking for the ultimate pier salmon rod; beefy butt, fast action sensitive tip.  Loomis make a blank that fits, I've only been bugging them since L.G. was still in business
I agree with Whopper.  They are true works of art and craftsmanship!!  Beautiful.  Pam
Chris, Nice work bud !!!!
Beautiful work Chris! Been kinda wondering where you have been lately. Good to see that all is well and you are just very busy!

....Okay then....  Nipissing if you need any help along the way just send me a PM.  Daplumma, yes two of them will be heading your way.  GB, no I don't turn wood handles but I would like to set up for making my own wood reel seats some day. I can and do custom turn cork handles but most guys balk at having it done when they hear the price....lol  Skiel, this rod will be on its way to you, today.....!
Very nice work!

....Well I have not been around much but what has been keeping me busy is fishing related....         I'm in various stages of work on a dozen rods with another six more to pick up! Got to get my butt in gear and finish these so I can find time to get out fishing.
Very nice Chris.  The word is,still to high and muddy  Good to hear from ya bud.
Wow, you have been busy, those look great Spiel, you do some really nice work that's for sure.  Maureen
Glad to see mines finished!!
Which is yours TJ? They look like all of mine! Very nice, Chris.
Very nice work there Chris.  When do you have time to work and sleep  Joey
they are nice looking rods
They look awesome.  What blanks did you work with Chris?
looks like you have been very productive.

....Thanks everyone.  Joey, I have to make time for work as it pays the bills it's sleep that I'm generally unable to find time for.  Trapshooter those are a mix of Frontier and Loomis blanks.  TJ, you wanted a rod?  Thanks Brian, not sure I'll find the time though?
looks good Chris have the riggers been installed yet??
....Ah no, not yet Mark. Won't take me long though once I get a day off with decent weather.
Awesome job as usual Chris, I'm always very impressed with the work you do !!

They look awesome spiel. Do you make rods for any species ? musky, walleye rods ? and do you turn any wood handles or all cork ?  Just for future reference. lol. I had a guy in MN make me a couple Loomis walleye rods with red cedar handles the wood really adds to the sensitivity and looks amazing too and it ended up weighing about 1 ounce more than the cork would have so the weight is no big deal. And he built them for cheaper than the retail versions ? don't know how he did that, but they are my favorite rods by far.  Just wondering encase I need some more rods one day, I'd rather stay in Canada.
Hi Spiel, is mine one of those in the pic?
....Thanks again everyone.  GB I'll get back to you on your questions, busy, busy, busy!  Oh and YES Kirk one of those is yours.
Awesome job Spiel!  I haven't started on my first yet, but that gives me some motivation!  Stan
Some mighty fine lookin' rods there my friend.
Love the green one on the right! That for me? LOL  Here's another one of Spiel's pieces of art....
And here's the best muskie rod I own. Spiel made it for me. It's a 7'7" G Loomis blank.
Spiel, those are magnificent!!   Would really love to be able to do that. Dug an old lightning rod up to practice on. Too close to summer to get into it now but will be next winters project.
Is one of those mine????And is another one for my brudder??Looks great bud,been sorta wondering where you were. Joe
Well done Chris! I have seen two of the rods that you have done and both were a worksof art.   Whopper

I have seen the rods Spiel is building for you guys... and all I can say is your gonna be impressed, they are sweet looking rods for sure! Its not about how many fish you put in the boat, but how you look doing it! LOL...  Enjoy the new rods guys!  Gerritt.

Chris,that is some awesome work bud,   Those wraps sure do take a lot of time to do,no wonder you have a sore back,leanning over the rods for so long at a time .By the way I saw Dougs, you made for him,nice.   Daplumma,yours and your brothers,are in a ABS PIPE with caps on the end of them LOL.  Steve
